name: Haiku Software Archives
tagline: Information on HaikuArchives and the software we archive.
body:
## What's this?
The Haiku Software Archives was founded in 2013 by @waddlesplash due to the fact that all over the web, BeOS and Haiku programs were vanishing -- often never to be seen again. The purpose of HaikuArchives is to archive the source code to any BeOS or Haiku program so that it might not be lost.

If you have an application (either yours or third-party) that cannot be found on the web, you can contact @waddlesplash via his [personal contact forum](https://www.haiku-os.org/user/15618/contact) or [post a reply here](http://www.haiku-os.org/community/forum/github_organization_archiving_source_orphaned_haikubeos_apps). (or if you have Git, you can find his email that way :)

## Where does all this software come from, anyway?
Known sources and software that comes from them:
